D𝐷D total datasets of I𝐼I number of benign devices
D′​(t)superscript𝐷′𝑡D^{\prime}(t) the claimed data size of the attacker
𝒘i​(t)subscript𝒘𝑖𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) local model weight parameters of the benign device i𝑖i
𝒘j′​(t)superscriptsubscript𝒘𝑗′𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{j}^{\prime}(t) training parameters of the malicious model at attacker j𝑗j
𝒘G′​(t)superscriptsubscript𝒘𝐺′𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{G}^{\prime}(t) the global model of FL under attack
βi,j′​(t)superscriptsubscript𝛽𝑖𝑗′𝑡\beta_{i,j}^{\prime}(t) the binary indicator for selecting benign local model weights
λ,ρ𝜆𝜌\lambda,\rho the Lagrangian dual variables
τi​(t)subscript𝜏𝑖𝑡\tau_{i}(t) the training delay of 𝒘i​(t)subscript𝒘𝑖𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) at device i𝑖i

𝓕^^𝓕\widehat{\boldsymbol{\mathcal{F}}} the reconstructed feature matrix at attacker
references: The remaining of this paper is structured as follows. Section II introduces the background of adversarial attacks against wireless systems and FL. Section III investigates the FL system model with malicious agents. The proposed VGAE-MP attack is described in Section IV. Section V discusses the performance analysis. Section VI concludes the paper. Table I lists the notation used in the paper.

S5.T2.caption: TABLE II: The setting of parameters in PyTorch
S5.T2.table:
Parameters Values
number of benign devices (I𝐼I) 5 ∼similar-to\sim 30
number of attackers (J𝐽J) 1 ∼similar-to\sim 5
communication rounds of the FL 100
number of local iterations (TLsubscript𝑇𝐿T_{L}) 10
model parameters in 𝒘i​(t)subscript𝒘𝑖𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) (M𝑀M) 100, 200, or 300
1st hidden layer size of the VGAE 32
2nd hidden layer size of the VGAE 16
learning rate of the VGAE 0.01
batch size of the SVM 30
learning rate of the SVM 0.001
regularization of the SVM loss function 0.01
k-Fold cross-validation 5
references:
The benign FL is designed to improve image classification accuracy, while the proposed VGAE-MP attack aims to reduce accuracy and cause label misclassification.
The number of benign devices I𝐼I increases from 5 to 30, while the number of attackers J𝐽J increases from 1 to 5. The global model 𝒘G′​(t)superscriptsubscript𝒘𝐺′𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{G}^{\prime}(t) in FL is trained with 100 communication rounds, and training of the local model 𝒘i​(t)subscript𝒘𝑖𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) is carried out in 10 iterations. For building the adjacency matrix 𝓐𝓐\boldsymbol{\mathcal{A}} at the attacker, the number of selected model parameters in 𝒘i​(t)subscript𝒘𝑖𝑡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t), i.e., M𝑀M, is set to 100, 200, or 300. The VGAE encoder is a two-layer GCN network with a dropout layer to prevent overfitting. The VGAE decoder is an inner product. The Adam optimizer with a learning rate of 0.01 is adopted to optimize the network. For all datasets, we use the same encoder, decoder and SVM models. Table II lists the setting of parameters in PyTorch.
